location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 353 of 1850 from Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to His Excellency Colonel Justin Sheil, Her Majesty's Minister Plenipotentiary and Envoy Extraordinary at the Court of Persia

mods.abstract: The letter relates to slave trading incidents on the Persian coast. It follows on from previous correspondence (see folio 26), reporting that the Native Agent at Bussorah [Basra] has sighted the boat brought up from Karrak [Bandar-e Charak], carrying thirty-two slaves to Bussorah and Mohumrah [Khorramshahr].
